title: Weird Lag Issues showing no ping spikes?
body: I recently have been playing league and get insane spikes where I have 22 ping which is normal but, I will play as if i just reached 2000. I also can move around with no lag but i cant see other champions and minions at all. My frames also don't drop at all, I have tried different ways with packet loss and wireless to wired connection. I don't know how or why this is happening but, this issue is making it unplayable. I have been playing for a couple years now with no issues from anything but a bad router one time. If anyone has had a fix or this issue resolved for them I would be more than happy to know the fix.

replies.body: There could be an issue with how your ISP might be routing to the game server.  You can run a traceroute with [WinMTR](http://winmtr.net/winmtr-v0-92-now-available/) and direct it to the NA game server 104.160.131.1.  A [log reader](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/209765743-Connection-Troubleshooting-Log-Reader) will also confirm if this is being caused by packet loss.  I haven't seen any issues with our services causing this, but we can do some troubleshooting to figure out what's going on.

I used log reader, shows anywhere from 5% to 18% packet loss over each game.
Ping is within tolerance.

I ran a traceroute using the built-in tracert command line tool.

Partial results:

I've included the part of the route that is outside of my neighborhood (i.e. excluded the part that would be the same for all external Internet addresses). And after reaching Riot routers, it goes on and on with lost packets until reaching the 30 maximum.
I replaced the asterisks that appear for lost packets with Xs since asterisks are not handled well on this forum.

Based on what I see here with the partial results, your routing looks okay but I'm assuming you ran this while nothing else was active in the background.   Congestion could also be involved, if you've got a lot of network activities at the same time while playing.   In this case, I recommend going over the [connection issues](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) to rule out some possibilities with more local factors.  Just test it out in a custom game as well, and run another route with [WinMTR](http://winmtr.net/winmtr-v0-92-now-available/) while that match is going on.  Hopefully that guide will do the trick and smooth things out.
